page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area we have studied is a rural area.Most of the land is farmed.The main crops this year have been oil seed rape and wheat.Some of the land is farmed by the National Institute of Agricultural Botany, in Cambridge,and is used for their experiments and field trials.Residents of Bar Hill are not allowed to let certain vegtables,if they grow them in their gardens or allotments,to go to seed.If they did then this could interfere with N.I.A.B.'s field trials. Three villages come into our study area,Bar Hill,Dry Drayton and part of Lolworth. The A604 major road from Harwich to Kettering runs through our block.Bar Hill is built alongside the A604 and both Dry Drayton and Lolworth are accessed from it.
